title: It's Not Unusual (Tom Jones) Dammit (You Missed Demmitt)
author: frankbmd

posts.post_title: It's Not Unusual (Tom Jones) Dammit (You Missed Demmitt)
posts.post_content:
Actually it's not unusual and Demmitt.  

Tom Jones is in VG condition with a Piedmont 150 reverse.

[IMG]http://www.collectorfocus.com/images/show/frankbmd/junk/28368/jones-tom[/IMG]

Tom Jones will be shipped somewhere for $26.  Could he be headed your way?

Ray Demmitt, the NY variation;), has seen better days and is in Fair/Good condition.  Ray does have some grass on the reverse from a wet sheet transfer.  The reverse is a Piedmont 350. 

[IMG]http://www.collectorfocus.com/images/show/frankbmd/junk/28367/demmitt[/IMG]

I'll ship Demmitt your way with the grassy behind.  HE GONE
No fee payments or pay 3% more for regular PP.

It is unusual to still have these cards.  

[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ub72eylahJg[/url]

From one tenor saxophonist to another, "Junior, I feel your pain."

C'mon guys -- how 'bout some love for Mr. Tom Jones.

He is the 121st most difficult subject in the set (tied with Elberfeld (N.Y.)).  So when you get past the 48 southern leaguers and the "traded" subjects like Brown-Dahlen-Kleinow-Smith he is definitely up there!  Underappreciated--certainly more so than the lounge singer. 

Now I have that crappy song in my head for the rest of the night.  Sorry I got involved . . . .
Demmitt!! That's a deal. I'll take it Frank. PP FF on the way.

This is Schilling. Curt, I guess.  

Well, sort of. :D

Nice cards no doubt. 

I'm waiting on the Mac Davis "Having my Baby" sale. :eek::eek:

It's not unusual........
